title: Using reference to the struct fields together with RwLock may lead to unsoung deadlock.
body:
std::sync::RwLock caused unsound deadlock working with reference to the struct I tried this code: ```rust use std::sync::{RwLock}; struct Test { pub read: u32, pub write: u32, } fn work_with_read(read: &u32) { println!("read {}", read); } async fn get_value() -> u32 { 42 } async fn test_deadlock(test_struct: RwLock) { let read_ref = { &test_struct.read().unwrap().read }; work_with_read(read_ref); let value = get_value().await; { println!("before deadlock!"); test_struct.write().unwrap().write = value; println!("after deadlock!"); } } #[tokio::main] async fn main() { let test_struct = RwLock::new(Test { read: 0, write: 0 }); test_deadlock(test_struct).await; } ``` I expected to see this happen: warning or compilation error shall be put since it breaks borrow checking rules. Instead, this happened: compilation suceeded, program is in deadlock state. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.66.0 (69f9c33d7 2022-12-12) binary: rustc commit-hash: 69f9c33d71c871fc16ac445211281c6e7a340943 commit-date: 2022-12-12 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.66.0 LLVM version: 15.0.2 ```
